children.text: First, the first Java program (codeforces_450_A) reads two integers n and m, then n more integers. It uses two queues.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text: The process is: while the first queue isn't empty, if the front element is ≤ m, it removes both queues' front elements and records the answer as the second queue's popped value.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text: If the front is > m, it subtracts m from the front element, moves it to the end of the first queue, and moves the corresponding second queue element to the end as well.
children.label: code_analysis

children.text: Else, subtract m from the front element, add it back to q1, and move the q2's element to the end.
children.label: code_analysis

children.text: The answer is the last value popped from the second queue.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text: The second Java program (atcoder_ABC172_D) takes an integer n, computes a sum based on divisors, and outputs the result.
children.label: code_analysis

children.text: The formula seems to be summing for each i from 1 to n, the term i multiplied by (n//i) times (n//i +1)/2.
children.label: code_analysis

children.text: Now, the key is that the output of the first Java program is the input to the second. So the first program's output (ans) is the input n for the second program.
children.label: high_level_plan

    implicit none

    integer :: n, m, ans_part1, ans_part2
    integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: q1, q2

    q2(1:n) = [(i, i=1,n)]

    length_q1 = n
    length_q2 = n
    ans_part1 = 0

    ! Process first part

            ! Append to q2

    print*, ans_part2

end program main

Putting it all together:

The full Fortran program would be:

program main

    implicit none

    integer :: n, m, ans_part1, ans_part2
    integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: q1, q2
    integer :: front_q1, front_q2, length_q1, length_q2, current_val, new_pos, new_pos_q2, i

    ! Read input for first part
    read*, n, m
    allocate(q1(n), q2(n))
    read*, q1(1:n)
    q2(1:n) = [(i, i=1,n)]

    front_q1 = 1
    front_q2 = 1
    length_q1 = n
    length_q2 = n
    ans_part1 = 0

    ! Process first part
    do while (length_q1 > 0)
        current_val = q1(front_q1)
        if (current_val <= m) then
            ans_part1 = q2(front_q2)
            front_q1 = front_q1 + 1
            front_q2 = front_q2 + 1
            length_q1 = length_q1 - 1
            length_q2 = length_q2 - 1
        else
            current_val = current_val - m
            ! Append to q1
            new_pos = mod(front_q1 + length_q1, n)
            if (new_pos == 0) new_pos = n
            q1(new_pos) = current_val
            ! Append to q2
            new_pos_q2 = mod(front_q2 + length_q2, n)
            if (new_pos_q2 == 0) new_pos_q2 = n
            q2(new_pos_q2) = q2(front_q2)
            front_q1 = front_q1 + 1
            front_q2 = front_q2 + 1
        end if
    end do

    ! Compute second part
    ans_part2 = 0
    do i = 1, ans_part1
        ans_part2 = ans_part2 + i * (ans_part1 / i) * (ans_part1 / i + 1) / 2
    end do

    print*, ans_part2

end program main
